pkgmetadata.longdescription: Implementation of the Nemenyi post-hoc test to find the groups of data that differ after a statistical test of multiple comparisons, e.g. Friedman test. Reference: Japkowicz/Shah (2011), Evaluating Learning Algorithms. Pages 255 ff. // Takes a matrix with samples (rows) for multiple groups (columns). Calculates Friedman-like ranks of the groups per row. Sums the ranks of each group over all samples. Calculates the pairwise difference between the summed ranks, representing the Nemenyi- value. Looks up the corresponding p-value from the studentized range (q)-distribution.
